head.title: Cherry Valley Springfield Central School District

form.name: form1
form.h1: Cherry Valley Springfield Central School District

div.span:
New York Governor Andrew Cuomo has ordered all schools to remain closed until May 15, 2020, with a tentative return on May 18th.
Please find all updates on our response to Coronavirus - including Instruction, Meal Program Opportunities and more - at cvscs.org/coronavirus.aspx

img.alt: Two different images of students at basketball events including one with students holding sign
Collage of students painting, caroling and a wintery image of the front of the school.
Tri-Valley Champions image of Girls and Boys team with details on next games and Go Patriots on bottom

img.title: School logo with US News and World Report best high schools logo over bottom right corner

span.div: It’s official! Cherry Valley-Springfield Central School is a 2020 Best High School, based on rankings that U.S. News & World Report published this week. By earning #2 in our region and a national ranking in the top 40%, CVS achieved status as a U.S. News Best High School.

img.title: Profile images of MMosenson and LLoveland with text below saying co-valedictorians

br.span: We are proud to announce the Co-Valedictorians for the Class of 2020 as Matthew Mosenson and Luke Loveland!

img.title: Coronavirus Updates with orange gradient background

br.span: Please find all Coronavirus Updates including Instruction, Meal Program Opportunities and more at cvscs.org/coronavirus.aspx

img.title: Counseling Department - Course Selection and Resources graphic

br.span: Check-out some new Student Support Resources from our Counseling Department, and (if you haven't done so already) all 8th, 9th and 11th graders can find a Course Selection form, all at: https://www.cvscs.org/Counseling.aspx

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; white-space: pre-wrap

div.span: Due to the ever-changing nature of the situation surrounding COVID-19, I have a very important update to share with you relative to a school closure extension.

div.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; color: #1c1e21; white-space: pre-wrap

img.title: Screenshot of updated coronavirus letter dated March 13, 2020

span.div: At the request of the Otsego and Schoharie County Departments of Health, all public schools in Otsego and Schoharie County will be closing for two weeks, beginning on Monday, March 16th. This decision was made in an abundance of caution, in hopes to slow the spread of COVID-19 in our area.

img.title: Screenshot of NY Health website page on coronavirus

br.span: While the Cherry Valley-Springfield Central School District does not have a confirmed case of COVID-9 in our school, we are aware of concerns in the community about the spread of this relatively new virus...

img.title: PreK Registration text over blurred background of PreK students playing in the Library

br.span: The early childhood programs at Cherry Valley-Springfield are child-centered. We pride ourselves on having staff dedicated to providing curriculum and support services to meet the individual needs of each child. To enroll your child in our PreK program, please follow these three steps...
